snippet: There is still time to undo an arbitrary sequester, which would slash billions in discretionary spending, before it does real harm to vital services.
abstract: Editorial identifies several crucial services that will be affected by budget cuts in sequester, which will indiscriminately slash $100 billion in discretionary spending; contends that should sequester happen, it is Republicans in Congress whom voters should hold responsible.
lead_paragraph: There is still time to undo an arbitrary sequester, which would slash billions in discretionary spending, before it does real harm to vital services.

headline.seo: Pain Ahead if the U.S. Goes Off the ‘Fiscal-Cliff’
